meanings.definition: A dark area or shape produced by a body coming between rays of light and a surface.
meanings.sent1: The cat chased its shadow playfully in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The tree cast a long shadow on the grass.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to step on his own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of doubt loomed over their decision.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of the mountain stretched across the valley.

meanings.definition: A faint or indistinct representation or semblance of something.
meanings.sent1: She saw a shadow of a figure in the fog.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure left only a shadow behind.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted a shadow of the city skyline.
meanings.sent4: His words were just a shadow of the truth.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of a smile played on her lips.

meanings.definition: To follow and observe (someone) closely and secretly.
meanings.sent1: The detective shadowed the suspect through the crowded market.
meanings.sent2: She decided to shadow her favorite author for a day.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tried to shadow the postman on his route.
meanings.sent4: He felt like someone was shadowing his every move.
meanings.sent5: The spy was tasked to shadow the diplomat during the conference.
